<p>Before beginning your integration, you need to <a href="/studio/checkout/advanced/getstarted?backend=node#setup-dev-environment" target="_blank">set up your development environment</a>. You can <a data-popup="open" href="https://www.paypalobjects.com/devdoc/HostedCardFields3Ds%20SequenceDiagram.png">refer to this flow diagram</a>, and <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=onqm2rKadvM" target="_blank">watch a video</a> demonstrating how to integrate PayPal Expanded Checkout.</p>

    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/checkout/advanced/sdk/v1/" target="_blank">Integrate PayPal buttons and Hosted Fields</a>
    instead.
</p></section></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="integrate-frontend"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="integrateAcdcFrontend" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h2>1. Integrate front end </h2>

<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">Set up your front end to integrate expanded checkout payments.</span></p>
<h3 style="line-height: 2;">Front-end process</h3>
<ol>
    <li style="line-height: 2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Your app shows the PayPal card fields and payment buttons</span></li>
    <li style="line-height: 2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Your app calls server endpoints to create the order and capture the payment. The request details depend on a number of factors, such as the type of payment method, and SDK component.</span></li>

</ol></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="frontend-code"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcFrontendCode" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">Front-end code </span>
</h3>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">The <code>/src/index.html</code> and <code>/src/app.js</code> files handle the client-side logic and define how the PayPal front-end components connect with the back end. Use these files to set up the PayPal checkout using the JavaScript SDK and handle the payer's interactions with the PayPal checkout button.</span></p>
<p>
</p>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">Youll need to: </span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">Save the <code>index.html</code> file in a folder named <code>/src</code>.</span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">Save the <code>app.js</code> file in a folder named <code>/src</code></span></li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="initialize-sdk"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcIntializeJsSdk" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3>Step 1. Initialize JavaScript SDK </h3>
<p>Add the JavaScript SDK to your web page and include the following: </p>
<ul>
    <li> Your app's client ID. </li>
    <li>A <code>&lt;div&gt;</code> to render the PayPal buttons. </li>
    <li>A <code>&lt;div&gt;</code> to render each of the card fields. </li>
</ul>
<p>The JavaScript file included in the sample code includes reference routes on the server that youll add in a later step. </p>

<p> Include the <code>&lt;script&gt;</code>tag on any page that shows the PayPal buttons. This script will fetch all the necessary JavaScript to access the buttons on the <code>window</code> object.</p>

<p>Pass a <code>client-id</code> and specify which <code>components</code> you want to use. The SDK offers Buttons, Marks, Card Fields, and other components. This sample focuses on the <code>buttons</code> component. </p>

<p>In addition to passing the <code>client-id</code> and specifying which <code>components</code> you want to use, you can also pass the currency you want to use for pricing. For this exercise, we'll use <code>USD</code>.</p></section></div></div><div><div class="Configurator-module_card_container__wG5_V"><div class="ohrotv0 ohrotv1" data-ppui-info="card_3.1.7__8.7.0"><div class="Configurator-module_card_header__gC6nn">Sign in to view credentials</div><div class="ohrotv6" data-ppui="true">Log in with your PayPal account to use your sandbox account credentials in code samples.</div><div><a class="nevxqv2 nevxqv5 nevxqv0 _118huxw7" data-ppui-info="links_5.0.8__8.7.0" href="https://www.paypal.com/signin?returnUri=https%3A%2F%2Fdeveloper.paypal.com%2Fstudio%2Fcheckout%2Fadvanced%2Fintegrate&amp;intent=developer&amp;ctxId=bd8526d6-4306-48e7-8d5b-b999bf417159">Log In or Sign Up</a></div></div></div><div class="Configurator-module_card_container__wG5_V"><div class="ohrotv0 ohrotv1" data-ppui-info="card_3.1.7__8.7.0"><div data-ppui="true"><div class="Configurator-module_configuration_item__aZAfO"><div class="_7c8im10 Configurator-module_horizontal_configuration_dropdown___ouEd" data-ppui="true">Currency</span></label></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div></div><div data-tag="iAcdcRenderPPButtonsTitle" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3>Step 2: Render Card fields and PayPal buttons</h3>

<p>
    After setting up the SDK for your website, you need to render the PayPal
    buttons and the card fields components.
</p></section></div></div><div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="card-fields"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcRenderCardFields" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">Card Fields</span></h3>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    The paypal namespace has a <code>CardFields</code> component to accept and save cards
    without handling card information. PayPal handles all security and compliance
    issues associated with processing cards. The <code>CardFields</code> function checks to see
    if a payment is eligible for card fields. If not, the card fields won't show
    up during the payment flow.
</span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        The <code>/src/app.js</code> file needs a function that submits a
        <code>createOrder()</code>
        request.
    </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Declare a <code>createOrder</code> callback that launches when the customer
        clicks the payment button. The callback starts the order and returns an
        order ID. After the customer checks out using the PayPal pop-up, this order
        ID helps you to confirm when the payment is completed.
    </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Set up your app to call <code>cardField.isEligible()</code> for each card
        field to determine if a payment is eligible for card fields.
    </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Render each card field by declaring it as an object in
        <code>cardField</code> and then applying a <code>.render()</code> function.
    </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">Create the order by calling the <code>createOrder</code> function.</span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Define styles for the card fields. You can change these styles as needed for
        your implementation.
    </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Define the <code>selector</code> and <code>placeholder</code> values for the
        input fields. You can edit this section as needed for your implementation,
        such as adding more fields. For more information about optional
        configurations, see
        </span><a style="font-size: 16px;" href="https://developer.paypal.com/sdk/js/reference/#link-options" target="_blank">
            Options in the JavaScript SDK reference.
        </a>
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div data-tag="iAcdcRenderCardFieldsPartII" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><ul>
    <li>
        <span style="font-size: 16px;">Set up your app to capture the payment when it is eligible for card fields
            by adding code to the PayPal button in
            <code>/src/app.js</code>, right after rendering the card
            fields.
        </span>
    </li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            You need to declare an event listener <code>/src/app.js</code> for when
            the payer submits an eligible card payment.
        </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Pass the card field values, such as the cardholder's name and address, to
            the <code>POST</code> call. Anything you pass into the
            <code>submit</code> function is sent to the iframe that communicates with
            the Orders API. The iframe retrieves the data and sends it along to the POST
            call. See the
        </span><a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2/" target="_blank">Orders v2 API</a>
        for details about billing address fields and other parameters. For example,
        use the
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/reference/country-codes/" target="_blank">
            2-character country code</a>
        to test the billing address.
    </li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Completing the payment launches an onApprove callback, which sends a
            call to <code>ordersCapture</code> method in the <code>OrdersController</code>
            using the <code>orderId</code> in the data object in the server. Use
            the <code>onApprove</code> response to update business logic, show a
            celebration page, or handle error responses.
        </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Set up your app to handle the payment capture response, such as when the
            payment is successfully captured, when the payer's instrument is declined,
            or when there is an error.
        </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Include a function that shows a message to the user by passing data to the
            <code>result-message</code> HTML element container of
            <code>index.html</code>.
        </span></li>

    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Your app needs to call the JavaScript SDK that defines the PayPal card
            fields and links them to the <code>createOrder()</code> function.
        </span></li>
</ul>

<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        If your website handles shipping physical items,
    </span><a href="https://developer.paypal.com/sdk/js/reference/#on-shipping-address-change" target="_blank">this</a>
    documentation includes details about our shipping callbacks.
</p></section></div></div><div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="pp-buttons"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcRenderPPButtons" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">PayPal Buttons</span></h3>

<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    The <code>paypal</code> namespace has a <code>Buttons</code> function that initiates the callbacks
    needed to set up a payment.
</span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        The <code>app.js</code> file needs a function that submits a <code>createOrder()</code> request.
    </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Declare a <code>createOrder</code> callback that launches when the customer clicks the
        payment button. The callback starts the order and returns an order ID. After
        the customer checks out using the PayPal pop-up, this order ID helps you to
        confirm when the payment is completed.
    </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Completing the payment launches an <code>onApprove</code> callback. Use the <code>onApprove</code>
        response to update business logic, show a celebration page, or handle error
        responses.
    </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Set up your app to handle the payment capture response, such as when the
        payment is successfully captured, when the payer's instrument is declined,
        or when there is an error.
    </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Include a function that shows a message to the user by passing data to the
        <code>result-message</code> HTML element container of <code>index.html</code>.
    </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Your app needs to call the JavaScript SDK that defines the PayPal buttons
        and links them to the <code>createOrder()</code> function.</span>
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div data-tag="iAcdcBillingToggle" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h4>Handle Billing Address</h4></section></div><div class="_1olq56r0 SectionToggle-module_section_toggle__BALAW" data-ppui-info="switch_4.1.5__8.7.0"><div class="_1olq56r6" data-ppui="true"><input aria-label="Enable" class="_1olq56ra" id="Switch_17715" role="switch" type="checkbox" data-ppui="true" checked=""/><label class="_1olq56r7" for="Switch_17715" data-ppui="true"><span data-ppui="true">Enable</span></label><span class="_1olq56r8" data-ppui="true"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2 _1olq56r9" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="checkmark sm icon" aria-hidden="true" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M3.352 9.586l3.398 3.399 8.46-8.462a.763.763 0 0 1 1.08 1.079l-9 9a.761.761 0 0 1-1.08 0l-3.937-3.938a.763.763 0 1 1 1.079-1.078z" clip-rule="evenodd" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></span></div></div></div><div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="customize-card-fields"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcCustomizeCardFields" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section>
<h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">Step 3: Customize the Card Fields&nbsp;<span style="color: rgb(0, 20, 53); font-family: PayPalOpen-Regular, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Arial, sans-serif; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: rgb(230, 224, 217); text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; float: none; border-radius: 8px; padding: 2px 8px; display: inline !important;">OPTIONAL</span></span></h3>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    This section explains how to customize the PayPal buttons and card fields for
    your integration.
</span></p>
<h4><span style="font-size: 16px;">Configure the layout of the card fields</span></h4>
<ul>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Copy and paste both
        </span><a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/checkout/advanced/customize/card-field-style/#link-examples" target="_blank">
            examples of card field style objects
        </a>
        into your existing <code>/src/index.html</code> and
        <code>/src/app.js</code> files.
    </li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Include the required card form elements: <code>card number</code>,
        <code>security code</code>, and <code>expiration date</code>. To learn about
        the available card form elements, see
        </span><a href="https://developer.paypal.com/sdk/js/reference/#link-cardfields" target="_blank">
            card fields </a>.
    </li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">Add your own fields to accept billing address information.</span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        A complete set of sample integration code is available from the
        </span><a href="https://github.com/paypal-examples/docs-examples/tree/main/advanced-integration/v2/" target="_blank">GitHub repo</a>.
    </li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Optional: Change the layout, width, height, and outer styling of the card
        fields, such as <code>border</code>, <code>box-shadow</code>, and
        <code>background</code>. You can modify the elements you supply as
        containers.
    </span></li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Configurator-module_card_field_customization__dSe_F"><div class="Configurator-module_configuration__nKJlY"><h4>Style parent Configure the layout of the Buttons component <span style="color: #001435; font-family: PayPalOpen-Regular, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 1.02rem; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: #e6e0d9; text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none; border-radius: 8px; padding: 2px 8px;">OPTIONAL</span></h3>

data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcIntegrate3dsJsSdk" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3>Integrate 3D Secure using JavaScript SDK</h3>
<p>
    To trigger 3D Secure authentication pass the verification method in the
    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2/#orders_create" target="_blank">Create order</a>
    payload. The verification method can be a contingencies parameter with
    <code>SCA_ALWAYS</code> or <code>SCA_WHEN_REQUIRED</code>:
</p>
<ul>
    <li>
        Pass <code>SCA_ALWAYS</code> to trigger an authentication for every
        transaction.
    </li>
    <li>
        Pass <code>SCA_WHEN_REQUIRED</code> to trigger an authentication only when
        required by a regional compliance mandate such as PSD2. 3D Secure is
        supported only in countries with a
        <a href="https://www.paypal.com/uk/webapps/mpp/PSD2?_ga=1.51925228.43968804.1640649786PSD2" target="_blank">PSD2 compliance mandate</a>.
    </li>
</ul></section></div><div class="_1olq56r0 SectionToggle-module_section_toggle__BALAW" data-ppui-info="switch_4.1.5__8.7.0"><div class="_1olq56r6" data-ppui="true"><input aria-label="Enable" class="_1olq56ra" id="Switch_17716" role="switch" type="checkbox" data-ppui="true"/><label class="_1olq56r7" for="Switch_17716" data-ppui="true"><span data-ppui="true">Enable</span></label><span class="_1olq56r8" data-ppui="true"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2 _1olq56r9" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="checkmark sm icon" aria-hidden="true" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 18 18" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M3.352 9.586l3.398 3.399 8.46-8.462a.763.763 0 0 1 1.08 1.079l-9 9a.761.761 0 0 1-1.08 0l-3.937-3.938a.763.763 0 1 1 1.079-1.078z" clip-rule="evenodd" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></span></div></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="AlertBox-module_alert_box_container__eBnDn"><div role="alert" class="_1m8egr60 _118huxw1 _1m8egr64 _1m8egr6b" data-ppui-info="alert_4.0.8__8.7.0"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f3 _1m8egr61 _1m8egr68" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="warning" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M12 2.25A9.75 9.75 0 1 0 21.75 12 9.76 9.76 0 0 0 12 2.25zm0 18A8.25 8.25 0 1 1 20.25 12 8.26 8.26 0 0 1 12 20.25zm-.75-7.5V7.5a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5 0v5.25a.75.75 0 1 1-1.5 0zm1.875 3.375a1.125 1.125 0 1 1-2.25 0 1.125 1.125 0 0 1 2.25 0z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span><div><section><p>
    Important: These are the 3D Secure instructions for the JavaScript SDK
    component <code>CardFields</code>. If your integration uses the
    <code>HostedFields</code> component, see
    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/checkout/advanced/customize/3d-secure/v1/sdk" target="_blank">Integrate 3D Secure using Hosted Fields</a>
    instead.
</p></section></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="integrate-backend"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="integrateStandardBackend" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h2>2. Integrate back end <span style="color: rgb(255, 255, 255); font-family: PayPalOpen-Regular, &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 1.02rem; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: start; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal; background-color: #7252cc; text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none; border-radius: 8px; padding: 2px 8px;">SERVER</span></h2>


<p>
    This section explains how to set up your backend to integrate PayPal&nbsp;checkout payments.
</p>

<p>
    The PayPal Server SDK provides integration access to the
    <a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/" target="_blank">PayPal REST APIs</a>. The API endpoints are divided into distinct controllers:
</p>

<ul>
    <li>
        Orders Controller:
        <a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2/" target="_blank">Orders API v2</a>
    </li>
    <li>
        Payments Controller:
        <a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/payments/v2/" target="_blank">Payments API v2</a>
    </li>


</ul>

<h3>Backend process</h3>

<ul>
    <li>
        Your app creates an order on the backend by calling to the
        <code>ordersCreate</code> method in the Orders Controller. See
        <a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2#orders_create" target="_blank">Create Orders V2 API endpoint</a>.
    </li>
    <li>
        Your app calls the <code>ordersCapture</code> method in the Orders
        Controller on the backend to move the money when the payer confirms the
        order. See
        <a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2#orders_capture" target="_blank">
            Capture Payment for Order V2 API endpoint </a>.
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="backend-code"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iStandardBackendCode" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">Backend Code</span></h3>
<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        The sample integration uses the PayPal Server SDK to
        connect to the PayPal REST APIs. Use the <code>server</code> folder to setup the
        backend to integrate with the payments flow.

    </span></p>
<ul>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">The server side code runs on port <code>8080</code></span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            Declare the <code>PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID</code> and
            <code>PAYPAL_CLIENT_SECRET</code> as environment variables. The server side
            code is configured to fetch these values from the environment to authorize the
            calls to the PayPal REST APIs.
        </span></li>
    <li><span style="font-size: 16px;">
            By default the server SDK clients are configured to connect to the PayPal's
            sandbox API.</span>
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="generate-access-token"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iStandardBackendAccessToken" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3><span style="font-size: 16px;">Step 1. Generate access token</span></h3>


<p><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Initialize the Server SDK client using OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials (<code style="">PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID</code> and <code style="">PAYPAL_CLIENT_SECRET</code>). The SDK will automatically retrieve the OAuth token when any endpoint that require OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials is invoked.
    </span></p></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="create-order"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iStandardBackendCreateOrder" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section>
<h3 style="line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">Step 2. Create Order</span></h3>

<p style="line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    You need a <code>createOrder</code> function to start a payment between a
    payer and a merchant
</span></p>

<p style="line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    Set up the <code>createOrder</code> function to make a request to the
    <code>ordersCreate</code> method in the Orders Controller and pass data from
    the cart object to calculate the purchase units for the order.
</span></p>

<p style="line-height: 1.2;"><span style="font-size: 16px;">
    See the
    </span><a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2/#orders_create" target="_blank">Create order endpoint of the PayPal Orders v2 API</a>
    for sample responses and other details.
</p></section></div></div><div><div class="Configurator-module_configuration__nKJlY"><div class="Configurator-module_configuration_item__aZAfO"><p class="_118huxw4 _118huxw0 tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section>
<h3 style=""><span style="font-size: 16px;">Step 3: Capture Payment</span></h3>

<p style=""><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        You need a <code>captureOrder</code> function to to move money from the payer
        to the merchant
    </span></p>

<p style=""><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        Set up the <code>captureOrder</code> function to make a request to the
        <code>ordersCapture</code> method in the Orders Controller and pass the
        orderID generated from the Create Order step.
    </span></p>

<p style=""><span style="font-size: 16px;">
        See the
    </span><a ref="noopener noreferrer" href="https://developer.paypal.com/docs/api/orders/v2/#orders_capture" target="_blank">Capture Payment for Order V2 API endpoint</a>
    for sample responses and other details.
</p></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="custom-integration"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcCustomIntegration" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h2>3. Custom Integration</h2>

<h3>Handle buyer checkout errors (optional)</h3>

<p>
    Use <code>onError</code> callbacks and alternate checkout pages to handle
    buyer checkout errors.
</p>

<p>
    If an error prevents buyer checkout, alert the user that an error has occurred
    with the buttons using the <code>onError</code> callback. This error handler
    is a catch-all. Errors at this point are not expected to be handled beyond
    showing a generic error message or page.
</p></section></div><div class="_1olq56r0 SectionToggle-module_section_toggle__BALAW" data-ppui-info="switch_4.1.5__8.7.0"><div class="_1olq56r6" data-ppui="true"><input aria-label="Enable" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h3>Handle funding failures (optional)</h3>

<p>
    If your payer's funding source fails, the Orders API returns an
    <code>INSTRUMENT_DECLINED</code> error.
</p>

<p>
    A funding source might fail because the billing address associated with the
    payment method is incorrect, the transaction exceeds the card limit, or the
    card issuer denies the transaction. To handle this error, restart the payment
    so the payer can select a different payment option.
</p></section></div><div class="_1olq56r0 SectionToggle-module_section_toggle__BALAW" data-ppui-info="switch_4.1.5__8.7.0"><div class="_1olq56r6" data-ppui="true"><input aria-label="Enable" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h2>4. Test integration</h2>

<p>
    Before going live, test your integration in the
    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/" target="_blank">sandbox environment</a>.
</p>
<p>
    Learn more about the following resources on the
    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/card-testing/" target="_blank">Card Testing</a>
    page:
</p>
<ul>
    <li>
        Use
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/card-testing/#link-testcardnumbers" target="_blank">test card numbers</a>
        to simulate successful payments for expanded checkout integrations.
    </li>
    <li>
        Use
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/card-testing/#link-rejectiontriggers" target="_blank">rejection triggers</a>
        to simulate card error scenarios.
    </li>
    <li>
        Test
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/card-testing/#link-simulate3dsecurecardpayments" target="_blank">3D Secure authentication</a>
        scenarios.
    </li>
    <li>
        Test your integration by following these
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/tools/sandbox/card-testing/#link-testintegration" target="_blank">recommended use cases</a>.
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div class="Anchor-module_anchor_hoc__FTum7 Anchor-module_integration_page__iwcMK" id="go-live"><button class="Anchor-module_anchor_button___rx87"><span role="img" class="_1x14h7f7 _1x14h7f2" data-ppui-info="icons_9.6.0__8.7.0" aria-label="link icon" data-ppui="true"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" fill="currentColor" viewBox="0 0 24 24" width="1em" height="1em" data-ppui="true"><path d="M22.5 8.271a5.102 5.102 0 0 1-1.5 3.47L17.742 15a5.086 5.086 0 0 1-3.621 1.5h-.005A5.12 5.12 0 0 1 9 11.235a.75.75 0 1 1 1.5.042 3.621 3.621 0 0 0 6.177 2.663l3.258-3.258a3.622 3.622 0 0 0-5.121-5.122l-1.032 1.031a.75.75 0 0 1-1.06-1.06L13.753 4.5a5.122 5.122 0 0 1 8.385 1.731 5.16 5.16 0 0 1 .362 2.04zm-12.281 9.134l-1.031 1.032a3.602 3.602 0 0 1-2.57 1.063 3.622 3.622 0 0 1-2.558-6.182l3.253-3.258a3.621 3.621 0 0 1 6.187 2.663.75.75 0 0 0 1.5.042A5.14 5.14 0 0 0 13.5 9a5.123 5.123 0 0 0-7.244 0L3 12.258a5.12 5.12 0 0 0 7.238 7.242l1.03-1.032a.75.75 0 0 0-1.05-1.063z" data-ppui="true"></path></svg></span></button><div data-tag="iAcdcGoLive" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div class="HtmlPageSection-module_step_content_section__HX_NU"><div><section><h2>5. Go live</h2>

<p>
    If you have fulfilled the requirements for accepting Expanded Credit and Debit
    Card Payments for your
    <a href="https://www.paypal.com/myaccount/bundle/business/upgrade" target="_blank">business account</a>, review the
    <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/api/rest/production/" target="_blank">
        Move your app to production
    </a>
    page to learn how to test and go live.
</p>

<p>
    If this is your first time testing in a live environment, follow these steps:
</p>

<ul>
    <li>
        Log into the
        <a href="https://developer.paypal.com/dashboard/" target="_blank">PayPal Developer Dashboard</a>
        with your PayPal business account.
    </li>
    <li>
        Complete
        <a href="https://www.paypal.com/unifiedonboarding/entry?country.x=US&locale.x=en_US&products=PPCP" target="_blank">production onboarding</a>
        so you can process card payments with your live PayPal business account.
    </li>
    <li>
        Request
        <a href="https://paypal.com/merchantapps/setup/checkout/advanced" target="_blank">Expanded Credit and Debit Card Payments</a>
        for your business account.
    </li>
</ul></section></div></div><div></div></div></div><div data-tag="TestCards" class="HtmlPageSection-module_base___x3IE" role="button" tabindex="0"><div
